sections.title: Context & Role Alignment
sections.goal: Understand the MLOps engineer's role within Phoenix Feature Store and how it interfaces with UX needs.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your day-to-day responsibilities on Phoenix Feature Store?
How does your work intersect with end-user or data scientist workflows?
What are the main success metrics you track for your role?

sections.title: Feature Store Architecture & Operations
sections.goal: Explore the technical architecture, CI/CD processes for models, and drift monitoring setup.
sample_questions: Could you describe the online/offline serving architecture and how you ensure consistency?
What are the key steps in your model CI/CD pipeline for Phoenix?
How are drift detection alerts currently surfaced and acted upon?

sections.title: Cross-Team Collaboration
sections.goal: Identify how MLOps collaborates with UX, Data Science, and SRE teams to deliver features.
sample_questions: When a new feature is requested by Data Science, how is it integrated into the store?
What channels do you use to coordinate with SRE for performance SLAs?
How do you communicate changes that might affect user-facing analytics tools?

sections.title: Challenges & Pain Points
sections.goal: Uncover operational bottlenecks, usability issues, and gaps in tooling.
sample_questions: What are the most common operational issues you face with Phoenix?
Are there any parts of the runbooks or RFCs that are unclear or outdated?
Can you share a recent incident where UX feedback led to a technical change?

sections.title: Future Improvements & Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Discuss planned enhancements, tradeoffs under consideration, and associated risks.
sample_questions: What improvements are you considering to reduce feature serving latency?
How do you balance rapid iteration with model governance requirements?
What risks do you foresee if drift monitoring thresholds are adjusted?
